doc.after: The end of the First World War and subsequent shortage of naval orders hit British shipbuilding very hard and John Brown only just survived. A fictionalised account of the hardships of the industry is portrayed in the 1939 feature film Shipyard Sally. Three great ships saved the yard: RMSÂ Empress of Britain, and the giant Cunard White Star Liners RMSÂ Queen Mary and RMSÂ Queen Elizabeth.
